extendedInfo.description: BatteryBot is the original battery indicator app for Android, released in 2009 as simply "Battery Indicator".  Both the free and the Pro versions have maintained a 4.5+ star rating in Google Play from the beginning. It offers two modes: the original status bar indicator and now also a desktop widget.  You can use either or both, as you please.For those who want more than is offered in the free version, or for those who just like to support small, independent developers like me, this Pro version remains lightweight while packing in many useful features:BatteryBot Pro monitors and shows your battery charge level (percent) as an icon in your status bar, with temperature, health, voltage, and time since plugged / unplugged in the notification area. It also has user-configurable alarms, logs, and widgets.Features:â¢ Automatic time-remaining estimates based on recent usageâ¢ Several icon sets (including fully configurable green, amber, red, and black icons)â¢ Small (1x1) and large (4x1) app widgetsâ¢ Notification (with status bar icon) is now optional -- can be used as just a desktop widgetâ¢ Battery logging. You can log the battery state (charge, status, voltage, temperature) and browse the logs on the phone or export to CSV.â¢ Manually or automatically disable / reenable device lock screen / lockscreen / keyguardâ¢ Alarms (full, charge above X, charge below X, temperature above X, or health failure)â¢ Control the notification priority on Android 4.1+ (For example, you can set to "minimum" to hide the icon but keep the notification in the tray.)â¢ Lots of configurability of behavior and appearance.â¢ The charging indicator (the bolt under the number that indicates when the device is being charged) for the sets that have it is optional in the Pro version.â¢ Very lightweight (please email me if you think otherwise, and I'll help you figure out what's wrong â I promise this app will not drain your battery!)â¢ Shows 1% increments even on most Motorola devices (option needs to be enabled on devices that default to 10% increments)â¢ Well-tested and supported on all major versions of Android (2.1, 2.2, 2.3, 3.0, 3.1, 4.0, 4.1, 4.2; Eclair, Froyo, Gingerbread, Honeycomb, Ice Cream Sandwich / ICS, Jelly Bean) and form factors (small phones, medium phones, large phones, 7-inch tablets, 10-inch tablets).â¢ Open source~~~~A one-time purchase now gets you free updates for life on all your Android devices.~~~~All requested app permissions are explained on the project website.~~~~Please email me if you have any questions or comments.~~~~If you wish to help beta-test new releases, there's now a Google+ community for that.  "BatteryBot Pro Beta Testers" https://plus.google.com/communities/108365502089038835850~~~~Here's the BatteryBot business model / philosophy:1) Ads are annoying. For some apps, ads might make sense, but a system utility should not have ads.2) The free version should be simple but useful; it shouldn't feel crippled.3) Some people choose to purchase the Pro version because they want extra features, some because they want more customization, and many because they just want to say "thanks" for the free version and support small, independent developers like myself.

reviews.title: Very Clean
reviews.comment: Nice, small footprint app. Easy to configure, and well worth it\'s price. I install this as one of my first apps on all of my devices.
reviews.author: TyDy Miler

reviews.title: Great app
reviews.comment: This could simply be an issue with my phone, but it seems to close often while I\'m using other programs, it\'s not due to a task kill app because I don\'t like them, so it\'s either my phone, a compatibility issue, or a software bug. EDIT, Narrowed it down to what I consider to be a glitch / incompatibility / clash, it seems that whenever I use Facebook app, FML official or chrome, they cause your application to close, forcing me to reopen to view battery percentages. Highly inconvenient.
reviews.author: Jason McPherson

reviews.title: Just excellent!
reviews.comment: I\'m still trying to figure out all of its capabilities, but so far I really love it.
reviews.author: Walter Scott

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: To be honest, after I\'ve tried and tested the most of this kind of apps from Google Play, this is the best app. which I\'ve ever seen. I\'ve used the free version for one month,before to upgrade to Pro (the paid one) and is worth every penny. Is very accurate, never fail etc. it works like a dream on Jelly Bean. All my admiration and congratulations to developer,and looking forward for more apps like this. Get it and you won\'t be sorry. Sincerely, Dan
reviews.author: Dan S

reviews.title: Excellent battery app
reviews.comment: I\'ve been using this app (including its predecessor, BatteryIndicator) for over three years now. True to the developer\'s words; this app maintains a small footprint, uses virtually no battery due to listening for updates from the OS rather than polling for the status, and performs exactly as expected. One request; would it be possible to get a semitransparent circle widget, or perhaps an option to make the widget background transparency user configurable?
reviews.author: Ryan Ross

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: The best battery app I\'ve found yet.
reviews.author: Dominic Gill

reviews.title: Very good app
reviews.comment: This app is accurate and reliable. That\'s all you can ask for apps,,,
reviews.author: Wayne CADDELL

reviews.title: Excellent!
reviews.comment: Very satisfied!
reviews.author: Alexe Daniel

reviews.title: Very disappointed
reviews.comment: Used the free version for ages and it seemed useful but decided to buy the full version because I wanted a alarm to notify me when the battery was getting hot. None of the alarm functions are visible on the SII or S4 and I\'ve tried contacting the developer a couple of times about this but had no reply. If I get a reply and a solution UK change my review.
reviews.author: Norman Young

reviews.title: Useless app don\'t worth a penny
reviews.comment: This application is useless and even Darshan team is deceiving people. I bought there pro app year ago and these guys moved all those battery features to a new battery indicator application. Now to use those feature people have to buy that app. Why do I have to buy that app when I already paid for it.
reviews.author: Sandeep Jaswal

reviews.title: Constantly forces close
reviews.comment: This is an issue on both my Samsung Galaxy S4 and my Note 10.1. It forces close every day, multiple times a day.
reviews.author: Melissa Carmona

reviews.title: Great app !!!
reviews.comment: No more needs to be said.

reviews.title: Not horrible
reviews.comment: I had a battery go bad and this program said it was still in good health.

reviews.title: So far the best
reviews.comment: So far, this is the best I\'ve seen with it being simple and easy.
reviews.author: Iswandi Mohamed Hussain

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.comment: What more could you want

reviews.title: Love it!!!
reviews.comment: I\'ve been using this app for about two and half or three years, and I\'ve never had any problems with it. Would recommend to anyone looking for a battery app.

reviews.comment: Just perfect

reviews.comment: Really enjoyed this app a lot very helpful

reviews.comment: Love it

reviews.title: Simply The Best
reviews.comment: I highly recommend this application it is the best battery indicator on the market and I have used it in every device I have owned this far I also recommend this application to all of my  friends hands down
